variants.Description in input context: homozygous W437X nonsense mutation in the PINK1 gene

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial respiratory function was analyzed in fibroblasts from a patient with early-onset Parkinsonism compared to normal fibroblasts.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced mitochondrial respiratory activity and decreased respiratory control ratio in patient fibroblasts.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts were used as a control group.

Basic negative control.Description: Patient-derived fibroblasts were compared to normal fibroblasts.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Respiratory control ratio > 2.0 and mitochondrial respiratory activity within 95% of control values

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Respiratory control ratio < 1.5 and mitochondrial respiratory activity < 70% of control values

Material used.Description: Cytochrome c levels were quantified in patient and normal fibroblasts.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss of cytochrome c protein stability
Readout description.Result Description: Reduced cytochrome c levels in patient fibroblasts compared to controls.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts were used as a control group.

Basic negative control.Description: Patient-derived fibroblasts were compared to normal fibroblasts.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cytochrome c expression within 90-110% of control values

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cytochrome c expression < 80% of control values

Material used.Description: ROS levels were quantified in patient and normal fibroblasts.

Readout description.Result Description: Elevated ROS production in patient fibroblasts compared to controls.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts were used as a control group.

Basic negative control.Description: Patient-derived fibroblasts were compared to normal fibroblasts.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ROS levels within 95-105% of control values
